description.content: Creates a new appointment for a patient in the specified country (PE or CL)

header.description: The Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header indicates whether the response can be shared with requesting code from the given [origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Origin). - [MDN Link](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Origin)

The Access-Control-Allow-Credentials response header tells browsers whether to expose the response to the frontend JavaScript code when the request's credentials mode ([Request.credentials](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/credentials)) is include. - [MDN Link](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Credentials)

item.name: Get appointments for an insured person

request.name: Get appointments for an insured person

description.content: Retrieves all appointments for a specific insured person with optional filtering and pagination

query.description: Maximum number of appointments to return (default: 50, max: 100)
Pagination key for next page of results

description.content:
Serverless API for managing medical appointments in Peru and Chile. This API provides endpoints for creating appointments and retrieving appointment history for insured users.

Contact Support:
 Name: API Support
 Email: support@medical-appointments.com
